reviewText:
Took a chance on it. I like Miniatures games and this is a mini's game simulation complete with a tabletop.

It's a WWI era turn based combat game, similar to Advance Wars for you younger guys. The intro makes War World 1 history acctually sound interesting, and the game play was pretty easy to understand.

Could use a little QA work. There's some language issues with the tutorial screen. I suspect the devs do not speak english as thier native langauge.

TL;DR:  Not bad, worth $10.
voteText: 44 of 54 people (81%) found this review helpful 2 people found this review funny

reviewText:
The game reminds me a lot of the Advance War series, but lacks the story and tactical depth (f.e. no supply consumption, ammo, or fuel)
I would give it a neutral critic, if steam would allow it. But since this is not possible, i will recomend it for some hours of fun, IF you can get it for a cheap price. (i bought it in a bundle for 4$).

+: extremly long campaign with many scenarios.
many ww1 units.
many historic references
multiplayer

-: no custom scenarios, or editor.
only french and german units
lots of crashes
AI makes many errors (f.e. not building any new units; attacking anti aircraft guns with planes)
bad UI, that doesnt give you any information about different units or terrain.
voteText: 25 of 26 people (96%) found this review helpful

reviewText:
A nice chilled, simple to pick up and play Turn Based Stratergy game.
Has a nice art style. Simple mechanics.
Lots of content 48+missions.
Not the most in depth experience in th TBS genre.
Nice little title nonetheless.

Here is my first impressions video

reviewText: Excellent little war gameEasy to learn and full of subtleties, the first maps are relatively easy but the difficulty increases with the variety of units.\nFor me a good value for money, relatively long game time for cheap price.

reviewText: A very good game. Just spent the last 4 hours going through the various scenarios. This is not Heart of Iron but is a very fun and complete hex-based gamefor strategy afficionados like me. I like the atmosphere and the ambiance. I'd just like a more comprehensive multiplayer.

reviewText: This game is really well done. It's sin is the lack of a skirmish mode right on the menu. It could previoulsy reward the player with that sensation of fast satisfaction that us, players of strategy games, have when defeating an AI. After all I believe in the team that made it and that they are going to make it possible in the future. It's a beautiful game, and EVERYONE that's a fan of Advance Wars and its alike games should buy it!! I recommend!

reviewText: I enjoyed this game a lot but some people who would rather have a fast-pasted shooting game may not like t as much. This game can be tricky in some levels but if you keep trying new strategies you can persevere. I also like the historical dialog at the start of the game and each level. I would recommend this game to gamers who like strategy and history like myself.\n\nI would absolutely say buy it if its on sale and its worth your money at $9.99
voteText: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful

reviewText: A notable game in that it actually attempts to educate the player with a summary of the main points of World War One, so thats quite fun! learning something while playing...  however the gameplay itself is a bit dull and tired, there really is nothing innovative here and its a standard hex battle game lacking polish. Annoying little things like the screen not centering upon unit selection, the maps all looking almost exactly the same in each scenario, the A.I not being particularly smart, and sadly the occasional game crash made me decide to uninstall this and concentrate on other things as time is too precious a resource! This game is okay, its 6/10, but given its price and basic gameplay, there are better hex based strategy games out there.

reviewText:
un·jol·ly
adj. un·jol·li·er, un·jol·li·est
Devoid of good humor and high spirits.
Never exhibiting or occasioning happiness or mirth; uncheerful: an unjolly tune.
Offensive; unenjoyable: had an unjolly time.
When a game developer sells you a game with the Multi-player Steam store tag, but makes no mention that this multiplayer mode is exclusively a single-PC hotseat mode, and you sit around on different continents with two copies of said game.
